title: Project Planning and Requirements Gathering
description: Define project scope, objectives, and requirements for the holographic telepresence system. Conduct research, gather user feedback, and document functional and non-functional requirements.

title: System Architecture Design for Holographic Telepresence System - Revised
description: Revised design of the overall system architecture for the holographic telepresence system, incorporating the following aspects: 1) Real-time 3D data capture and transmission using Structure from Motion (SfM) and Multi-view stereo (MVS), 2) Holographic display and rendering employing digital micromirror device (DMD) technology or spatial light modulators, 3) User interaction and control mechanisms utilizing eye tracking, gesture recognition, and voice commands, 4) Network infrastructure and bandwidth requirements, with a focus on adaptive streaming and congestion avoidance techniques, 5) Security and privacy considerations (including end-to-end encryption using Elliptic Curve Diffie–Hellman (ECDHE), authentication through OAuth2.0, and authorization using Role Based Access Control (RBAC)), emphasizing secure communication channels and data protection, 6) Scalability and performance optimization strategies, such as load balancing, caching, and horizontal scaling, 7) Integration with existing communication platforms (voice, video, and data), incorporating APIs for seamless integration and providing backward compatibility, 8) Flexibility to accommodate future enhancements and technology advancements, by designing modular components with a microservices architecture.

title: 3D Holographic Rendering
description: Develop algorithms and techniques for real-time 3D holographic rendering, including depth perception, occlusion handling, and realistic lighting.

title: Remote Communication and Telepresence
description: Implement real-time audio/video streaming, data synchronization, and user interaction mechanisms for immersive remote communication and telepresence.

title: User Interface and Experience Design (Update for Clarification) - Revised
description: Design intuitive, user-friendly interfaces for controlling and interacting with the holographic telepresence system. This includes designing interfaces for initial setup, user navigation, management of holographic content, and providing clear feedback to users about system status, connectivity, and performance. Additionally, consider accessibility and localization needs for a global user base.

title: Security and Privacy Considerations
description: Implement security measures to protect user data and ensure privacy during holographic communications.

title: Testing and Quality Assurance
description: Develop comprehensive test plans and strategies for validating the holographic telepresence system's functionality, performance, and user experience.

title: Deployment and DevOps
description: Plan and implement the deployment strategy, including infrastructure provisioning, continuous integration/deployment pipelines, and monitoring for the holographic telepresence system.

title: Documentation and User Support
description: Create comprehensive documentation, user guides, and support resources for the holographic telepresence system.
